title: Cactus Cowboy: Plants at War mod menu UI with cheats, spawners, rainbow background, process selector, and game cover image

requirements.text: Replace the current BrowserPage-only UI with a new Mod Menu page for “Cactus Cowboy: Plants at War” that exposes: Fly, Super Speed, Super Jump, Item Spawner (user-created list), Disable Monsters, Rainbow Background, Process Selector, and Prefab Spawner (from a prefab list).

quotes: Make a cactus cowboy plants at war Mod menu fly super speed Super jump item spawner (list create) Disable monster make the backround Rainbow make a process selecter. ... make a prefab spawner with a list of prefabs from the game

acceptanceCriteria: Launching the app shows a Mod Menu page (not the iframe browser UI).
The Mod Menu page contains controls for Fly, Super Speed, Super Jump, Disable Monsters, Rainbow Background, Process Selector, and spawner tools.
All user-facing text on the Mod Menu page is in English.

requirements.text: Implement Fly, Super Speed, and Super Jump controls in the Mod Menu UI, including multipliers for speed and jump, and persist these settings per user (authenticated via Internet Identity).

quotes: Mod menu fly super speed Super jump

acceptanceCriteria: Fly, Super Speed, and Super Jump each have a toggle control.
Super Speed has a multiplier control; Super Jump has a multiplier control.
Toggling/adjusting settings persists and is restored after refresh/login.
The ModStatusBar reflects the enabled state and shows multiplier values for speed/jump.

requirements.text: Add a “Disable Monsters” toggle in the Mod Menu UI and persist it per user profile.
acceptanceCriteria: Disable Monsters can be toggled on/off from the Mod Menu.
The toggle state persists per user and is restored after refresh/login.
The ModStatusBar shows a “NO MONSTERS” badge when enabled.

requirements.text: Add a “Rainbow Background” visual effect toggle that, when enabled, applies a rainbow/animated background styling to the Mod Menu page without affecting functionality.
acceptanceCriteria: Rainbow Background can be toggled on/off from the Mod Menu.
When enabled, the Mod Menu page background visibly becomes rainbow/animated (or rainbow gradient).
When disabled, the page returns to the normal background.

requirements.text: Implement a Process Selector UI in the Mod Menu page using the existing backend process selector and available-process list APIs, allowing the user to select and persist a target process.
acceptanceCriteria: The Mod Menu page displays a process selector panel with a dropdown of available processes and a refresh action.
Selecting a process persists to the backend and is restored on reload.
If a previously selected process is missing, the UI clearly indicates it.

requirements.text: Implement an Item Spawner tool that supports creating and managing a user-defined list of items (add/remove/clear), persisted per user, and shows a log/history of spawn actions in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can add items to a personal spawn list, remove items, and clear the list.
The spawn list is persisted per user and restored after refresh/login.
The UI shows a spawn log/history entries when spawning an item from the list.

requirements.text: Add a Prefab Spawner that uses a prefab list (catalog) “from the game”, lets users browse/search prefabs, and add selected prefabs to the spawn list (or spawn directly), persisting chosen prefabs per user.

quotes: make a prefab spawner with a list of prefabs from the game

acceptanceCriteria: A prefab list UI exists with search/filter capability (by name/id/category/description).
A user can select a prefab and add it to their spawn list and/or trigger a spawn action.
The chosen prefab entries persist per user and are restored after refresh/login.

requirements.text: Update the backend canister types and APIs so mod settings stored in the user profile align with the Mod Menu features (Fly, Super Speed, Super Jump, Disable Monsters) rather than the current placeholder field names, and ensure the frontend uses the updated fields end-to-end.

quotes: Mod menu fly super speed Super jump ... Disable monster

acceptanceCriteria: Backend Candid types expose mod settings fields that directly match the Mod Menu toggles (Fly, Super Speed, Super Jump, Disable Monsters).
Frontend reads/writes those fields without relying on the current placeholder semantic mapping.
Saving and loading a profile correctly round-trips mod settings values.

requirements.text: Display a “Cactus Cowboy: Plants at War” cover image on the Mod Menu page (e.g., in the header/hero area) using a generated static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated.

quotes: Make the Picture cactus cowboy plants at war game cover

acceptanceCriteria: A cover image is present as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and is rendered on the Mod Menu page.
The image is responsive (does not overflow on small screens) and has appropriate alt text in English.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; add backend/migration.mo only if required by an actual stable-state upgrade need.

Do not modify frontend immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui/*.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Implementing real game memory injection/modding for “Cactus Cowboy: Plants at War” (this app only stores and presents mod/spawn settings).
Auto-detecting live game processes from the user’s device (processes are selected from the provided available-process list).
Adding third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.

required: Game cover art illustration featuring a cactus cowboy in a desert action/combat scene with a playful arcade shooter vibe, high contrast, poster-like composition (cactus-cowboy-plants-at-war-cover.dim_1024x1536.png)
